newsitem.title: UK: BT eyes 10-15 pct of Italian phone market.
newsitem.headline: BT eyes 10-15 pct of Italian phone market.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc said on Thursday it aimed to win 10-15 percent of the Italian telephone market by 2006/7 through its Albacom joint venture.

The national reach of Albacom, a venture between BT, banking group Banca Nazionale del Lavoro and communications company Mediaset Spa, was boosted earlier after Italian energy group Eni (Ente Nazionale Idrocarburi Spa) took a 35 percent stake.
Albacom will have the right to use Eni's national fibre optic network and extensive infrastructure.
"Eni is a very major company with an extensive fibre optic network," a BT spokesman said in London. "This (deal) enhances the venture."

Albacom plans to become the second Italian operator in fixed telephony. After Eni's entry, BT and BNL's holding will be diluted to 45.5 percent. They hold the stake through an investment vehicle called Albacom Holding. Mediaset will own 19.5 percent directly.
Albacom's individual shareholders, with other companies, may also bid for Italy's third licence to provide communication services in the country's booming mobile market.
